   - mRNA codons (triplet nucleotide sequences) are read by ribosomes.

   - Ribosomes catalyze peptide bond formation between adjacent amino acids, elongating the polypeptide chain.
   - The process includes initiation (ribosome assembly), elongation (amino acid addition), and termination (release at stop codon).
